question.title: Docker Compose Java containers fail to start with "Failed to start thread 'VM Thread' - pthread_create failed (EPERM)"
question.body:
I'm trying to run a multi-container application with Docker Compose that includes Java services, but I'm running into an issue with the Java containers. The web container (Next.js) starts fine, but both Java services fail to initialize with the following error:

[0.103s][warning][os,thread] Failed to start thread "VM Thread" - pthread_create failed (EPERM) for attributes: stacksize: 1024k, guardsize: 4k, detached.
Error occurred during initialization of VM
Cannot create VM thread. Out of system resources.

Here's the output from docker-compose logs:

Attaching to compass-admin_resource_1, compass-admin_api_1, compass-admin_web_1
api_1       | [0.103s][warning][os,thread] Failed to start thread "VM Thread" - pthread_create failed (EPERM) for attributes: stacksize: 1024k, guardsize: 4k, detached.
api_1       | Error occurred during initialization of VM
api_1       | Cannot create VM thread. Out of system resources.
resource_1  | [0.046s][warning][os,thread] Failed to start thread "VM Thread" - pthread_create failed (EPERM) for attributes: stacksize: 1024k, guardsize: 4k, detached.
resource_1  | Error occurred during initialization of VM
resource_1  | Cannot create VM thread. Out of system resources.
web_1       |   ▲ Next.js 14.2.16
web_1       |   - Local:        http://af26e35c0d2b:3000
web_1       |   - Network:      http://192.168.128.4:3000
web_1       |
web_1       |  ✓ Starting...
web_1       |  ✓ Ready in 73ms

The error suggests there might be permission issues or resource limitations, but I'm not sure how to fix it. The error code EPERM typically indicates permission issues. I've verified that:

The host system has sufficient memory and CPU resources I'm running the command with sufficient permissions

What might be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?
